moves.1. e4: E4, i prefer from the d4 playing as black.
moves.1... e5: e5, but i also like the Sicilian!
moves.3. Bc4 Nf6: I like this variation a lot, both playing as white or black.
moves.4. Nc3 Bc5 5. O-O O-O: I organized my defence and i'm ready for the next step!
moves.6. Re1: Well that move helps me move my knight.
moves.7... d6: Now i open the line for my white bishop.
moves.8. d3: He did quite the same. Though h3 would be a little better i think.
moves.8... h6: Now the g5 square is protected.
moves.10. a3: a3, seems quite pathetic to me.
moves.10... Qe7 11. b4: He's pushing my bishop, i think a good move.
moves.14... c6: c6 i think is good, what do you think?
moves.15. Ba2 Qf6: Now i move my queen to a nice square combined with the knight.
moves.16. Kh2: I don't know about this move. Maybe Be3 would be better.
moves.16... Nxf3+: Now it's time for some exchanging.
moves.17. Qxf3: He took it with his queen.
moves.18... Bd4 19. Rab1: I guess i'm doing it good so far, and i have no serious worries.
moves.19... Be6: I wanted to exchange the white bishops.
moves.20. Bxe6 fxe6: So we exchanged our bishops and i open the f line for the rook.
moves.21... Rf6 22. f4 Raf8: I prefered not to take at this the pawn but move the one rook behind the other.
moves.23. f5 exf5: i took the f5 pawn, why not?
moves.24. f3 fxe4: I took the e4 pawn too.
moves.25. dxe4 Rg6+: Now a check and a pawn up.
moves.26. Kh2 d5 27. exd5 cxd5: Some pawn exchange. I think i'm doing good still.
moves.28. Rbe1: He might wanted the e5 pawn.
moves.29. Rxe5: And he trapped as he took the pawn but he forgot something.
